reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best one yet
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had a lot of coffee makers recently. I am the only one that drinks coffee in my house. A one cup maker is really important to me. Recently, the “competition” one cup makers are expensive and are awful. They break within a year. Coffee is NOT hot. Leak everywhere. Coffee grinds in each cup made.My friend kept saying how much she LOVES her Hamilton Beach Flexbrew. So I bought it on cyber Monday. I’d had it with my POS Keurig. This coffee maker is AMAZING. It’s hot. The single cup brewing system is amazing. Pot of coffee is great also. I don’t use k-cups and the pod this one comes with is great. Not messy and simple. ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ HIGHLY RECOMMEND

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is the one!
reviews.reviewText: I searched high and low for a dual coffee maker that we would like and would be functional. There is always a lot of coffee happening in our house, especially over the holidays. We always had a higher end brand, so I bought that one first, and it was a disaster. The single cup maker sprayed all over the place, no matter what I did. Then, remembering our trusty Mr. Coffee from the old days, I bought this one. It's the bomb. Not a single issue. Fits both Keurig pods and our grocery store's brand without being finicky. Coffee is consistent. It's super easy to use.I do wish I could adjust the warming temperature. And it's weird that you can't use the single use while the carafe is pre-set for the next morning - so you'd better remember to click that back on after! But this no-frills coffee maker is definitely the one. But those are minor "complaints." I just wish I had bought this one first!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A thoughtfully designed coffee maker.
reviews.reviewText: My partner and I both drink coffee. He drinks less than I do but he enjoys flavored (gross) coffee while I can’t stand most of it (because it’s awful). Further, I hate how the flavors tend to linger in fresh batches after previously brewing adulterated coffees. This machine seems to be the ideal solution for us. It’s got a full size carafe for non-revolting coffee while he can use the pods for an occasional “flavored” “coffee”. I’ve never bought a pod machine before so I don’t know if it’s standard for them to come with their own DIY pod, but this one does and I love that since I’m pretty sure the pods aren’t recyclable and because IMO pod coffee never tastes as good as when freshly ground.I have one critique and that is that when the machine loses power for any length of time, the clock will reset. I feel like, in 2024, that really should no longer be an issue but otherwise I appreciate the minimal yet complete feature set. I also wish it had come with a plastic and/or metal coffee filter, but that’s a small quibble.Some reviews here indicate that the coffee from the pod side isn’t hot enough. I prefer to be able to drink my coffee without scalding my tongue or without having to wait. For me, this is a feature and not a bug, but I can see that some might not prefer it this way.We’re on day two but I’m really happy with this coffee maker.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Reliable Coffee Savior - The Hamilton Beach FlexBrew Trio
reviews.reviewText: The Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker has been a true game-changer in my morning routine, especially after dealing with the frustrations of a Cuisinart that broke three times after just one year of use each time. Here's why the FlexBrew Trio has become my go-to coffee maker:Durability and Reliability (5/5):After experiencing the disappointment of a Cuisinart repeatedly breaking down, I was eager to find a coffee maker that could stand the test of time. The Hamilton Beach FlexBrew Trio has proven to be incredibly durable and reliable. It's been a year, and it's still going strong, which is a testament to its build quality.Versatility (5/5):One of the standout features of the FlexBrew Trio is its versatility. I love having the option to brew a single cup of coffee using ground coffee or a K-Cup, as well as making a full pot when I have guests over. It's like having two coffee makers in one, and it suits various coffee preferences.User-Friendly (5/5):This coffee maker is exceptionally user-friendly. The controls are straightforward, and the setup is a breeze. Plus, the ability to adjust the strength of your brew is a nice touch, allowing you to customize your coffee just the way you like it.Consistent Performance (5/5):The FlexBrew Trio consistently delivers excellent coffee, and I haven't experienced any hiccups or issues with it. The coffee is brewed at the right temperature, ensuring a flavorful and satisfying cup every time.Conclusion (5/5):In conclusion, the Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker has been a coffee savior in my household, especially after dealing with the frustration of a Cuisinart that broke three times in as many years. Its durability, versatility, user-friendliness, and consistent performance have made it an indispensable part of my morning routine. If you're looking for a reliable and versatile coffee maker that won't let you down, the FlexBrew Trio is an excellent choice. I couldn't be happier with my decision to make the switch!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A true flex-brew - great coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: I own a Keurig Duo Essentials. Love it! But it doesn't have all the individual cup size options as my Keurig 2.0 had. That was an adjustment.After reading the specs of the Hamilton Beach Flex Brew, I found it has everything I was looking for in one machine. Brews up to a 14 oz single cup.I really like the individual water reservoirs for being single cups and the carafe brewing.Not only does it come with its own basket for single cups, it has an adapter for k-cups and it accepts the reusable k-cups that you put your own coffee grounds into.The downside I've seen so far: it functions very poorly with hot cocoa k-cups. I resorted to emptying the cocoa k-cups into a cup and using the machine for hot water.Functions poorly when brewing CrioBru cacao in a gold mesh brewing basket.However, all in all, it's a great machine so far.
EL diseño es elegante, ademas utilizarla es muy sencillo. Es muy practica ya que si no tienes los contenedores de cafe, trae un filtro integrado con el que puedes preparar tazas individuales.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love everything about this machine
reviews.reviewText: This is one of the best machines I have ever owned. The temperature is just right, it is fast, it has a strength control, multiple size control and can accommodate any cup size. It can use pods, refill cups and has a quick easy to remove assembly to change from pod to filter basket in a flash. I have K-cup reuse pods that fit it perfectly so can continue using those too. All the parts disassemble easy to clean out the piercing needles and baskets with ease. The water chamber on single serve holds over a litre of water and is easy clean and fill. The other side can brew up to 12 cups if in need of a lot of coffee at one time. Pot side has a timer to set if you want it to brew and be ready for you n the morning. Only thing I wish they had added, was a reuse filter basket for the pot side, I would pay that extra, but they are easy to find to buy. This is a well thought out brew station, it comes with easy to understand instructions and took just minutes to. Set up. I have used tea, coffee grounds, pods, and every size cup to test it, each fills perfectly to size you set on single serve, even my tall travel mug fits. I simply love this machine, amazing options for the price. I think anyone that tries it will love it too.

This is my second one. We broke the pot on the old one and decided to get a new brewer because of the age of the other one.They’re great machines and we like the option of brewing a single cup when the craving hits.I highly recommend it.
